title: Putin speaks out about Wagner Group rebellion
description: Russian President Putin addressed his nation for the first time since the Wagner Group’s rebellion, saying it was a “militarized mutiny” committed by “traitors.” The whereabouts of the group’s chief Yevgeny Prigozhin, who released his own message earlier on Monday, is still unknown.

title: World reacts to Wagner Group’s armed rebellion in Russia
description: China expressed support for Russia’s efforts to maintain national stability, while other world leaders like NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg said Russian President Vladimir Putin “made a big mistake.”

title: Full speech: Putin defiant in address to nation after attempted armed rebellion
description: In his first remarks since the Wagner Group’s attempted rebellion, Russian President Vladimir Putin thanked Wagner mercenary fighters and commanders who had stood down “to avoid bloodshed.” He also said he would honor his promise to allow fighters to relocate to Belarus.

title: Putin vows those behind Russian mercenary rebellion will face justice
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin vowed Monday that those responsible for the armed revolt that plunged his country into chaos would be "brought to justice."

title: Russian embassy squatter leaves proposed site near Australia’s parliament
description: A Russian diplomat squatter was forced to leave the site of a proposed embassy in Canberra, Australia, after the country’s highest court rejected Russia’s bid.

title: Photos: 24 hours that took Russia to the brink of civil war
description: Wagner Group uprising in the southern city of Rostov-on-Don forces Putin to negotiate with his own commanders.

title: Thousands of North Koreans march in anti-U.S. rallies as country marks Korean War anniversary
description: Tens of thousands of North Koreans marched in anti-U.S. rallies and warned of "merciless" revenge as part of the 73rd anniversary of the Korean War.

title: Haruki Murakami pleads for keeping Tokyo park and baseball stadium that inspired his writing
description: Author Haruki Murakami expressed strong opposition to the removal of his favourite jogging path and baseball stadium that inspired his writing

title: Police detain 50 after Pride march in Istanbul
description: Turkish police detained at least 50 people on Sunday after Istanbul’s LGBTQ community held their annual Pride march.

title: Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney among new investors backing F1 team Alpine in $218 million deal
description: After soccer, Hollywood stars Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney are setting their sights on Formula One.

title: Russian defense minister makes first appearance since Wagner rebellion
description: Days after a mercenary rebellion from the Wagner Group called for his ouster, Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu made a public appearance while meeting with troops in Ukraine.

title: Squatter leaves after Russia loses bid to stop Australia from evicting its embassy
description: Australia’s highest court on Monday dismissed Russia’s application for an injunction to stop Moscow’s embassy from being evicted from the capital, Canberra.
